verses.text: So they brought the ark of God and set it in the midst of the tent that David had pitched for it, and they offered burnt sacrifices and peace offerings before God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when David had finished offering the burnt offerings and the peace offerings, he blessed the people in the name of the LORD.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he dealt to all Israel, both men and women, to each one a loaf of bread and a good piece of flesh and a flagon of wine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he appointed certain of the Levites to minister before the ark of the LORD and to record and to thank and praise the LORD God of Israel:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Asaph, the chief, and next to him Zechariah, Jeiel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Mattithiah, Eliab, Benaiah, Obededom: and Jeiel with psalteries and with harps, but Asaph resounded with cymbals;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Benaiah and Jahaziel, the priests, with trumpets continually before the ark of the covenant of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then, on that day, David began to thank the LORD by the hand of Asaph and his brethren.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Give thanks unto the LORD, call upon his name, make known his deeds among the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sing unto him, sing psalms unto him, speak of all his wondrous works.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Glory in his holy name; let the heart of those that seek the LORD rejoice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seek the LORD and his strength, seek his face continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember his marvellous works that he has done, his wonders and the judgments of his mouth;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O, ye seed of Israel, his slave, ye sons of Jacob, his chosen ones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is the LORD our God; his judgments are in all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be mindful always of his covenant, the word which he commanded in a thousand generations,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the covenant which he cut with Abraham, and of his oath unto Isaac;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which he confirmed unto Jacob by statute, and to Israel in everlasting covenant,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, Unto thee will I give the land of Canaan, the cord of your inheritance,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: when ye were but few in number, and strangers in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they went from nation to nation and from one kingdom to another people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He would allow no one to oppress them; he reproved kings for their sakes,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, Touch not my anointed, and do my prophets no harm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sing unto the LORD, all the earth; show forth from day to day his saving health.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Declare his glory among the Gentiles; his marvellous works among all peoples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For great is the LORD, and greatly to be praised; he also is to be feared above all gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For all the gods of the people are worthless, but the LORD made the heavens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Glory and beauty are in his presence; strength and gladness are in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Give unto the LORD, ye families of the peoples, give unto the LORD glory and strength.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Give unto the LORD the glory of his name; bring a present and come before him; worship the LORD in the beauty of holiness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fear before him, all the earth; the world also is being made stable, that it be not moved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let the heavens be glad, and let the earth rejoice; and let men say among the Gentiles, The LORD reigns.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let the sea roar, and the fullness thereof; let the fields rejoice, and all that is therein.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then shall the trees of the wood sing out at the presence of the LORD, because he comes to judge the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O give thanks unto the LORD, for he is good; for his mercy is eternal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And say, Save us, O God our saving health, and gather us together and deliver us from the Gentiles, that we may give thanks to thy holy name and glory in thy praise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blessed be the LORD God of Israel from eternity unto eternity. And all the people said, Amen and praised the LORD.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he left there before the ark of the covenant of the LORD Asaph and his brethren to minister before the ark continually, each thing in its day;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Obededom with their brethren, sixty-eight; Obededom also the son of Jeduthun and Hosah to be porters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Zadok, the priest, and his brethren, the priests, before the tabernacle of the LORD in the high place that was at Gibeon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to offer burnt offerings unto the LORD upon the altar of the burnt offering continually morning and evening, according to all that is written in the law of the LORD, which he commanded Israel;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and with them Heman and Jeduthun and the rest that were chosen expressly by name, to give thanks to the LORD, because his mercy is eternal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And with them Heman and Jeduthun with trumpets and cymbals to sound, and with other musical instruments of God. And the sons of Jeduthun were porters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the people departed each one to his house; and David returned to bless his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it came to pass, as David dwelt in his house, that David said to Nathan, the prophet, Behold, I dwell in a house of cedars, and the ark of the covenant of the LORD under curtains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Nathan said unto David, Do all that is in thy heart for God is with thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass the same night that the word of God came to Nathan, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go and tell David my slave, Thus hath the LORD said, Thou shalt not build me a house to dwell in,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for I have not dwelt in a house since the day that I brought up Israel unto this day, but have gone from tent to tent, and from one tabernacle to another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherever I have walked with all Israel, did I speak a word to any of the judges of Israel, whom I commanded to feed my people, saying, Why have ye not built me a house of cedars?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, therefore, thus shalt thou say unto my slave David, Thus hath the LORD of the hosts said, I took thee from the sheepfold, from following the sheep that thou should be ruler over my people Israel;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I have been with thee wherever thou hast walked and have cut off all thy enemies from before thee and have made thee a name like the name of the great men that are in the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Likewise I have ordained a place for my people Israel and have planted him that he dwell by himself and no longer be moved; neither shall the sons of iniquity waste them any more, as before,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: since the time that I commanded judges to be over my people Israel. I have humbled all thy enemies and announce unto thee that the LORD will build thee a house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it shall come to pass, when thy days are fulfilled to go to be with thy fathers, that I will raise up thy seed after thee, which shall be of thy sons; and I will establish his kingdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall build me a house, and I will establish his throne eternally.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will be his father, and he shall be my son; and I will not take my mercy away from him, as I took it from him that was before thee;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but I will confirm him in my house and in my kingdom for ever, and his throne shall be established for evermore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: According to all these words, and according to all this vision, so did Nathan speak unto David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David, the king, came and sat before the LORD and said, Who am I, O LORD God, and what is my house, that thou hast brought me here?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And yet this was a small thing in thy eyes, O God, for thou hast also spoken of thy slaveâ€™s house for a great while to come and hast regarded me according to the estate of a man of high degree, O LORD God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What more can David add asking thee to glorify thy slave? For thou knowest thy slave.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O LORD, for thy slaveâ€™s sake and according to thy own heart, thou hast done all this greatness, in making known all thy great things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O LORD, there is none like thee, neither is there any God beside thee, according to all that we have heard with our ears.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And what one nation in the earth is like thy people Israel, whom God went to ransom to be his own people, to make thee a name of greatness and terribleness, by driving out the Gentiles from before thy people, whom thou didst redeem out of Egypt?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thy people Israel didst thou make thy own people for ever, and thou, LORD, didst become their God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, now, LORD, let the thing that thou hast spoken concerning thy slave and concerning his house be established for ever and do as thou hast said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let it even be established, that thy name may be magnified for ever, that it may be said, The LORD of the hosts, God of Israel, is God unto Israel; and let the house of David thy slave be established before thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thou, O my God, hast told thy slave that thou wilt build him a house; therefore, thy slave has found in his heart to pray before thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now, LORD, thou art God and hast promised this goodness unto thy slave;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: now it has pleased thee to bless the house of thy slave, that it may be before thee for ever; for thou, O LORD, hast blessed it, and it shall be blessed for ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now after this it came to pass that David smote the Philistines and subdued them and took Gath and her towns out of the hand of the Philistines.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he smote Moab, and the Moabites became Davidâ€™s slaves, bringing him presents.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David smote Hadarezer, king of Zobah in Hamath, as he went to establish his dominion unto the river Euphrates.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David took from him a thousand chariots, seven thousand horsemen, and twenty thousand footmen; David also hamstrung all the chariot horses, but reserved those of one hundred chariots.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the Syrians of Damascus came to help Hadarezer, king of Zobah, David slew of the Syrians twenty-two thousand men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David put garrisons in Syria, the Syria of Damascus, and the Syrians became Davidâ€™s slaves, bringing him presents. For the LORD saved David wherever he went.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David took the shields of gold that the slaves of Hadarezer carried and brought them to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Likewise from Tibhath and from Chun, cities of Hadarezer, David took very much brass, with which Solomon made the brasen sea and the pillars and the vessels of brass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Tou, king of Hamath, heard how David had smitten all the host of Hadarezer, king of Zobah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he sent Hadoram, his son, to King David, to greet him and to bless him because he had fought against Hadarezer and smitten him, for Hadarezer had war with Tou. And he sent him all manner of vessels of gold and silver and brass,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which King David dedicated unto the LORD, with the silver and the gold that he brought from all these Gentiles, from Edom and from Moab and from the sons of Ammon and from the Philistines and from Amalek.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, Abishai, the son of Zeruiah, smote Edom in the valley of salt, eighteen thousand men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he put a garrison in Edom, and all the Edomites became Davidâ€™s slaves. Thus the LORD saved David wherever he went.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So David reigned over all Israel and executed judgment and righteousness among all his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joab, the son of Zeruiah, was over the host; and Jehoshaphat, the son of Ahilud, writer of the chronicles;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Zadok, the son of Ahitub, and Abimelech, the son of Abiathar, were the priests; and Shavsha was scribe;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Benaiah, the son of Jehoiada, was over the Cherethites and the Pelethites; and the sons of David were first, at the hand of the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it came to pass after this that Nahash the king of the sons of Ammon, died, and his son reigned in his stead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David said, I will show mercy unto Hanun, the son of Nahash, because his father showed mercy to me. And David sent ambassadors to comfort him concerning his father. So the slaves of David came into the land of the sons of Ammon to Hanun, to comfort him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the princes of the sons of Ammon said to Hanun, Does it seem unto thee that David honours thy father, that he has sent comforters unto thee? Are not his slaves come unto thee to search and to overthrow and to spy out the land?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Hanun took Davidâ€™s slaves and shaved them, and cut off their garments in half, exposing their buttocks and sent them away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they left, and it was told David how the men were served. And he sent to meet them, for the men were greatly ashamed. And the king said, Tarry at Jericho until your beards are grown and then return.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the sons of Ammon saw that they had made themselves odious to David, Hanun and the sons of Ammon sent a thousand talents of silver to hire chariots and horsemen out of Syria of the rivers (Mesopotamia), and out of Syria of Maachah and out of Zobah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they hired thirty-two thousand chariots, and the king of Maachah and his people, who came and pitched camp before Medeba. And the sons of Ammon gathered themselves together from their cities and came to battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when David heard of it, he sent Joab and all the host of the mighty men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Ammon came out and put the battle in order before the gate of the city, and the kings that had come were by themselves in the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Joab saw that the battle was set against him before and behind, he chose out of all the choice of Israel and put them in order against the Syrians.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he put the rest of the people into the hand of Abishai, his brother, putting them in order against the sons of Ammon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, If the Syrians are too strong for me, then thou shalt save me; but if the sons of Ammon are too strong for thee, then I will save thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be of good courage, and let us behave ourselves valiantly for our people and for the cities of our God; and let the LORD do that which is good in his sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joab and the people that were with him drew near before the Syrians unto the battle; and they fled before him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the sons of Ammon saw that the Syrians had fled, they likewise fled before Abishai, his brother, and entered into the city. Then Joab returned to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the Syrians saw that they were smitten before Israel, they sent ambassadors and drew forth the Syrians that were beyond the river, whose captain was Shophach, the prince of the host of Hadarezer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when it was told David, he gathered all Israel and passed over the Jordan and came upon them and ordered his host against them. And when David had put his troops in order against the Syrians, they fought with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Syrians fled before Israel, and David slew of the Syrians those of seven thousand chariots, and forty thousand footmen; likewise he killed Shophach, the captain of the host.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the slaves of Hadarezer saw that they were smitten before Israel, they made peace with David and became his servants; neither would the Syrians help the sons of Ammon any more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, that after the year was expired, at the time that kings go out to battle, Joab led forth the power of the army and destroyed the country of the sons of Ammon and came and besieged Rabbah. But David tarried at Jerusalem. And Joab smote Rabbah and destroyed it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David took the crown of their king from off his head and found it to weigh a talent of gold, and there were precious stones in it; and it was set upon Davidâ€™s head. And in addition to this he took exceeding much spoil out of the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he brought out the people that were in it and dominated them with saws, and with harrows of iron, and with axes. Even so dealt David with all the cities of the sons of Ammon. And David and all the people returned to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass after this that there arose war at Gezer with the Philistines at which time Sibbechai the Hushathite, slew Sippai, of the lineage of the giant; and they were subdued.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there was war again with the Philistines, and Elhanan, the son of Jair, slew Lahmi, the brother of Goliath the Gittite, whose spear staff was like a weaverâ€™s beam.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And yet again there was war at Gath, where there was a man of great stature, who had twenty-four fingers and toes, six on each hand, and six on each foot; and he also was the son of the giant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when he dishonoured Israel, Jonathan, the son of Shimea, Davidâ€™s brother slew him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were born unto the giant in Gath; and they fell by the hand of David and by the hand of his slaves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Satan stood up against Israel and provoked David to number Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David said to Joab and to the princes of the people, Go, number Israel from Beersheba even to Dan; and bring the number of them to me, that I may know it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joab answered, The LORD make his people a hundred times as many more as they are; but, my lord the king, are they not all my lordâ€™s slaves? Why then does my lord require this thing? Why will he be a cause of guiltiness unto Israel?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless, the kingâ€™s word prevailed against Joab. Therefore, Joab departed and went throughout all Israel and came to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joab gave the sum of the number of the people unto David. And they found in all Israel eleven times one hundred thousand men that drew sword, and of Judah four hundred seventy thousand men that drew sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Among these the Levites and the sons of Benjamin were not counted, for the kingâ€™s word was abominable to Joab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God was also displeased with this word; therefore, he smote Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David said unto God, I have sinned greatly because I have done this thing; but now, I beseech thee, take away the iniquity of thy slave, for I have done very foolishly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the LORD spoke unto Gad, Davidâ€™s seer, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go and tell David, saying, Thus hath the LORD said, I offer thee three things: choose one of them that I will do unto thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Gad came to David and said unto him, Thus hath the LORD said, Choose thee,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: either three yearsâ€™ famine or three months to be destroyed before thy foes while the sword of thine enemies overtakes thee or else three days of the sword of the LORD, even the pestilence, in the land, and the angel of the LORD destroying throughout all the borders of Israel. Now therefore advise thyself what word I shall bring again to him that sent me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David said unto Gad, I am in a great strait; let me fall now into the hand of the LORD, for very great are his mercies, but do not let me fall into the hand of man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the LORD sent pestilence upon Israel; and seventy thousand men of Israel fell.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God sent an angel unto Jerusalem to destroy it; and as he was destroying, the LORD beheld, and he repented of that evil and said to the angel that destroyed, It is enough, stay now thy hand. And the angel of the LORD stood by the threshingfloor of Ornan, the Jebusite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David lifted up his eyes and saw the angel of the LORD stand between the heaven and the earth, having a drawn sword in his hand stretched out over Jerusalem. Then David and the elders of Israel, who were clothed in sackcloth, fell upon their faces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David said unto God, Is it not I that commanded the people to be numbered? Even I it is that have sinned and done evil indeed; but as for these sheep, what have they done? Let thy hand, I pray thee, O LORD my God, be against me and against my fatherâ€™s house, but not on thy people, that they should be plagued.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the angel of the LORD told Gad to tell David that David should go up and set up an altar unto the LORD in the threshingfloor of Ornan the Jebusite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David went up according to the word of Gad, which he had spoken unto him in the name of the LORD.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Ornan turned back and saw the angel, and his four sons with him hid themselves. Now Ornan was threshing wheat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as David came to Ornan, Ornan looked and saw David and went out of the threshingfloor and bowed himself to David with his face to the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David said to Ornan, Grant me the place of this threshingfloor, that I may build an altar therein unto the LORD; thou shalt grant it to me for the full price, that the plague may be stayed from the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Ornan said unto David, Take it to thee, and let my lord the king do that which is good in his eyes; I even give thee the oxen for burnt offerings and the threshing instruments for wood and the wheat for the present; I give it all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And King David said to Ornan, No, but I will truly buy it for the full price, for I will not take that which is thine for the LORD, nor offer burnt offerings without cost.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So David gave to Ornan for the place six hundred shekels of gold by weight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David built there an altar unto the LORD and offered burnt offerings and peace offerings and called upon the LORD, and he answered him from the heavens by fire upon the altar of burnt offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the LORD spoke to the angel, he put up his sword again into its sheath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time when David saw that the LORD had answered him in the threshingfloor of Ornan, the Jebusite, then he sacrificed there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the tabernacle of the LORD, which Moses made in the wilderness, and the altar of the burnt offering were at that season in the high place at Gibeon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but David could not go before it to enquire of God, for he was afraid because of the sword of the angel of the LORD.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David said, This shall be the house of the LORD God, and this shall be the altar of the burnt offering for Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David commanded to gather together the strangers that were in the land of Israel, and he made them masons to hew wrought stones to build the house of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Likewise, David prepared iron in abundance for the nails for the doors of the gates, and for the joinings, and brass in abundance without weight,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: also cedar trees in abundance, for the Zidonians and those of Tyre brought much cedar wood to David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David said, Solomon, my son, is yet young and tender, and the house that is to be built for the LORD must be magnificent par excellence, of fame and of glory throughout all lands; I will therefore now make preparation for it. So David prepared abundantly before his death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he called for Solomon, his son, and charged him to build a house for the LORD God of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David said to Solomon, My son, as for me, it was in my heart to build a house unto the name of the LORD my God;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but the word of the LORD came to me, saying, Thou hast shed blood abundantly and hast made great wars; thou shalt not build a house unto my name because thou hast shed much blood upon the earth in my sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, a son shall be born to thee, who shall be a man of rest, and I will give him rest from all his enemies round about, for his name shall be Solomon, and I will give peace and quietness unto Israel in his days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall build a house for my name, and he shall be my son, and I will be his father; and I will establish the throne of his kingdom over Israel for ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, my son, the LORD be with thee, and be thou prospered and build the house of the LORD thy God, as he has said of thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only the LORD give thee wisdom and understanding and give thee commandments for Israel, and that thou keep the law of the LORD thy God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then shalt thou be prospered if thou shalt keep thyself to do the statutes and rights which the LORD charged Moses with concerning Israel; be strong and of good courage; dread not, nor be dismayed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, behold, in my trouble I have prepared for the house of the LORD one hundred thousand talents of gold and a thousand thousand talents of silver, and the brass and iron are without weight, for it is in abundance. Likewise, I have prepared timber and stone, unto which thou shalt add.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover there are workmen with thee in abundance, hewers and workers of stone and timber and all manner of expert men for every manner of work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the gold, the silver, and the brass and the iron, there is no number. Arise therefore, and go to work, and the LORD be with thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David, likewise, commanded all the princes of Israel to help Solomon, his son, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is not the LORD your God with you who has given you rest on every side? For he has given the inhabitants of the land into my hand, and the land is subdued before the LORD and before his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now set your heart and your soul to seek the LORD your God; arise therefore and build the sanctuary of the LORD God, to bring the ark of the covenant of the LORD and the holy vessels of God into the house that is to be built unto the name of the LORD.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when David was old and full of days, he made Solomon, his son, king over Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he gathered together all the princes of Israel, and the priests and the Levites,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: were numbered from the age of thirty years and upward; and their number by their polls, man by man, was thirty-eight thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of which, twenty-four thousand were to set forward the work of the house of the LORD, and six thousand were officers and judges;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: moreover, four thousand were porters, and four thousand praised the LORD with the instruments which David had made to praise therewith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David divided them into courses according to the sons of Levi, namely, Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Gershon: Laadan and Shimei.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Laadan: Jehiel, the first, Zetham and Joel, three.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Shimei: Shelomith, Haziel, and Haran, three. These were the chief of the fathers of Laadan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Shimei: Jahath, Zina, Jeush, and Beriah. These four were the sons of Shimei.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jahath was the first, and Zizah the second, but Jeush and Beriah did not multiply in many sons; therefore, they were in one reckoning, according to their fatherâ€™s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Kohath: Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel, four.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Amram: Aaron and Moses. And Aaron was separated, that he should be dedicated to the most holy things, he and his sons for ever, to burn incense before the LORD, to minister unto him and to bless in his name for ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Moses, the man of God, were counted in the tribe of Levi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Moses were Gershon and Eliezer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the sons of Gershon, Shebuel was the chief.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the son of Eliezer was Rehabiah, the chief. And Eliezer had no other sons, but the sons of Rehabiah were very many.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Izhar: Shelomith, the chief.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Hebron: Jeriah, the first, Amariah, the second, Jahaziel, the third, and Jekameam, the fourth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Uzziel: Michah, the first, and Jesiah, the second.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Merari: Mahli and Mushi. The sons of Mahli: Eleazar and Kish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Eleazar died and had no sons, but daughters and their brethren, the sons of Kish, took them as wives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Mushi: Mahli, Eder, and Jeremoth, three.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Levi after the houses of their fathers, even the chief of the fathers, as they were counted by number of names by their polls, that did work in the ministry of the house of the LORD, from the age of twenty years and upward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For David said, The LORD God of Israel has given rest unto his people, and he shall dwell in Jerusalem for ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And also unto the Levites, they shall no longer carry the tabernacle, nor any vessels of it for its ministry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For by the last words of David, the Levites were numbered from twenty years old and above.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And their station was at the hand of the sons of Aaron for the service of the house of the LORD, in the courts, and in the chambers, and in the purifying of all holy things, and in the work of the ministry of the house of God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: both for the showbread and for the fine flour for the sacrifice and for the unleavened cakes and for that which is baked in the pan and for that which is fried and for all manner of measure and size,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to stand every morning to thank and praise the LORD, and likewise in the evening;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to offer all burnt sacrifices unto the LORD in the sabbaths, in the new moons and solemnities, by number, according to the order commanded unto them, continually before the LORD.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And that they should keep the charge of the tabernacle of the testimony and the charge of the holy place and the charge of the sons of Aaron, their brethren, in the ministry of the house of the LORD.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Aaron also had their courses. The sons of Aaron: Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Nadab and Abihu died before their father and had no children; therefore, Eleazar and Ithamar had the priesthood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David distributed them, Zadok being of the sons of Eleazar, and Ahimelech of the sons of Ithamar, according to their turns in their ministry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there were more men found of the sons of Eleazar than of the sons of Ithamar, and thus were they divided. Among the sons of Eleazar, there were sixteen chief men of the houses of their fathers and eight among the sons of Ithamar according to the houses of their fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They divided them, therefore, by lot, one with another for of the sons of Eleazar and of the sons of Ithamar there were princes of the sanctuary and princes of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Shemaiah, the scribe, the son of Nethaneel, one of the Levites, wrote them before the king and the princes and before Zadok, the priest, and Ahimelech, the son of Abiathar, and the heads of the fathers of the priests and Levites; one paternal house being taken for Eleazar, and one taken for Ithamar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the first lot came forth to Jehoiarib, the second to Jedaiah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the third to Harim, the fourth to Seorim,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the fifth to Malchijah, the sixth to Mijamin,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the seventh to Hakkoz, the eighth to Abijah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the ninth to Jeshua, the tenth to Shecaniah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the eleventh to Eliashib, the twelfth to Jakim,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the thirteenth to Huppah, the fourteenth to Jeshebeab,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the fifteenth to Bilgah, the sixteenth to Immer,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the seventeenth to Hezir, the eighteenth to Aphses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the nineteenth to Pethahiah, the twentieth to Jehezekel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the twenty-first to Jachin, the twenty-second to Gamul,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the twenty-third to Delaiah, the twenty-fourth to Maaziah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were their orderings in their service to come into the house of the LORD, according to their right, in the ministry of Aaron, their father, as the LORD God of Israel had commanded him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And of the sons of Levi that remained: Of the sons of Amram, Shubael; of the sons of Shubael, Jehdeiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rehabiah; of the sons of Rehabiah, the chief was Isshiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the Izharite; Shelomoth; and the son of Shelomoth, Jahath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And of the sons of Jeriah: Amariah the second, Jahaziel the third, Jekameam the fourth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Uzziel: Michah; and the son of Michah, Shamir.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The brother of Michah was Isshiah; and the son of Isshiah, Zechariah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Merari: Mahli and Mushi; the son of Jaaziah, Beno.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Merari by Jaaziah: Beno, Shoham, Zaccur, and Ibri.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of Mahli came Eleazar, who had no sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Kish; the son of Kish, Jerahmeel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Mushi: Mahli, Eder, and Jerimoth. These were the sons of the Levites according to the houses of their fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These, likewise, cast lots over against their brethren, the sons of Aaron, in the presence of David, the king, and Zadok, and Ahimelech, and the chief of the fathers of the priests and Levites, even the principal fathers over against their younger brethren.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover David and the captains of the host separated unto the ministry the sons of Asaph and of Heman and of Jeduthun, who should prophesy with harps, with psalteries, and with cymbals; and the number of men that were suitable for the work of their respective ministry was,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of the sons of Asaph: Zaccur, Joseph, Nethaniah, and Asarelah, the sons of Asaph under the direction of Asaph, who prophesied at the hand of the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of Jeduthun: the sons of Jeduthun: Gedaliah, Zeri, Jeshaiah, Hashabiah, and Mattithiah, six, under the hand of their father Jeduthun, who prophesied with a harp, to give thanks and to praise the LORD.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of Heman: the sons of Heman: Bukkiah, Mattaniah, Uzziel, Shebuel, Jerimoth, Hananiah, Hanani, Eliathah, Giddalti, and Romamtiezer, Joshbekashah, Mallothi, Hothir, and Mahazioth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these were the sons of Heman, the kingâ€™s seer, in the words of God, to lift up the horn. And God gave to Heman fourteen sons and three daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these were under the direction of their father for song in the house of the LORD, with cymbals, psalteries, and harps, for the ministry of the house of God, under the hand of the king, of Asaph, of Jeduthun, and of Heman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the number of them, with their brethren that were instructed in the songs of the LORD, even all that had understanding, was two hundred eighty-eight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they cast lots, ward against ward, the small as well as the great, the one with understanding as well as the disciple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the first lot came forth for Asaph to Joseph; the second to Gedaliah, who with his brethren and sons were twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the third to Zaccur, he, his sons, and his brethren were twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the fourth to Izri, he, his sons, and his brethren were twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the fifth to Nethaniah, he, his sons, and his brethren were twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the sixth to Bukkiah, he, his sons, and his brethren were twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the seventh to Jesharelah, he, his sons, and his brethren were twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the eighth to Jeshaiah, he, his sons, and his brethren were twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the ninth to Mattaniah, he, his sons, and his brethren were twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the tenth to Shimei, he, his sons, and his brethren were twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the eleventh to Azareel, he, his sons, and his brethren were twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the twelfth to Hashabiah, he, his sons, and his brethren were twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the thirteenth to Shubael, he, his sons, and his brethren were twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the fourteenth to Mattithiah, he, his sons, and his brethren were twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the fifteenth to Jeremoth, he, his sons, and his brethren were twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the sixteenth to Hananiah, he, his sons, and his brethren were twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the seventeenth to Joshbekashah, he, his sons, and his brethren were twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the eighteenth to Hanani, he, his sons, and his brethren were twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the nineteenth to Mallothi, he, his sons, and his brethren were twelve:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the twentieth to Eliathah, he, his sons, and his brethren were twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the twenty-first to Hothir, he, his sons, and his brethren were twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the twenty-second to Giddalti, he, his sons, and his brethren were twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the twenty-third to Mahazioth, he, his sons, and his brethren were twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the twenty-fourth to Romamtiezer, he, his sons, and his brethren were twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Concerning the divisions of the porters, of the Korhites: Meshelemiah, the son of Kore, of the sons of Asaph.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Meshelemiah: Zechariah, the firstborn, Jediael, the second, Zebadiah, the third, Jathniel, the fourth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Elam, the fifth, Jehohanan, the sixth, Elioenai, the seventh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Obededom: Shemaiah, the firstborn, Jehozabad, the second, Joah, the third, and Sacar, the fourth, Nethaneel, the fifth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ammiel, the sixth, Issachar, the seventh, Peulthai, the eighth; for God had blessed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also unto Shemaiah, his son, were sons born, that ruled throughout the house of their fathers, for they were mighty men of valour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Shemaiah: Othni, Rephael, Obed, Elzabad, and their brethren, strong men; likewise, Elihu and Semachiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these of the sons of Obededom; they and their sons and their brethren, valiant men strong for the ministry, were sixty-two, of Obededom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Meshelemiah had sons and brethren, valiant men, eighteen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of Hosah, of the sons of Merari: Simri, the chief, (for though he was not the firstborn, yet his father made him the chief)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hilkiah the second, Tebaliah, the third, Zechariah, the fourth; all the sons and brethren of Hosah were thirteen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Among these were the divisions of the porters, even among the chief men, having wards one against another two by two, to minister in the house of the LORD.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they cast lots, the small as well as the great, according to the houses of their fathers, for each gate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the lot of the east fell to Shelemiah. Then for Zechariah, his son, a wise counsellor, they cast lots; and his lot came out for the north.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To Obededom towards the Negev; and to his sons the house of consultation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To Shuppim and Hosah to the west, with the gate Shallecheth, by the causeway of the going up, ward against ward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To the east six Levites, to the north four by day, to the Negev four by day, and toward the house of the consultation two by two.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At the chamber of the vessels to the west, four in the way and two in the chamber.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the divisions of the porters among the sons of Kore and among the sons of Merari.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And of the Levites, Ahijah was over the treasures of the house of God and over the treasures of the holy things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As concerning the sons of Laadan; the sons of Gershon: of Laadan; chief fathers of Laadan were Gershon and Jehieli.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Jehieli: Zetham and Joel, his brother, who were over the treasures of the house of the LORD.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the Amramites, and the Izharites, the Hebronites, and the Uzzielites,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shebuel, the son of Gershon, the son of Moses, was ruler of the treasures.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his brother Eliezer, Rehabiah, his son, Jeshaiah, his son, Joram, his son, Zichri, his son, and Shelomith, his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This Shelomith and his brethren were over all the treasures of the holy things, which David, the king, and the chief fathers, the captains over thousands and hundreds, and the princes of the host had dedicated.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That which out of the spoils won in battles they had dedicated to maintain the house of the LORD.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Likewise, all that Samuel, the seer, and Saul, the son of Kish, and Abner, the son of Ner, and Joab, the son of Zeruiah, and all that anyone had dedicated; it was under the hand of Shelomith and of his brethren.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the Izharites, Chenaniah and his sons were governors and judges over Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the Hebronites, Hashabiah and his brethren, men of valour, a thousand seven hundred, presided over Israel on the other side of the Jordan westward in all the work of the LORD and in the service of the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the Hebronites was Jerijah, the chief among the Hebronites, according to the generations of his fathers. In the fortieth year of the reign of David they were sought for, and there were found among them mighty men of valour at Jazer of Gilead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his brethren, men of valour, were two thousand seven hundred chief fathers, whom King David made rulers over the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half tribe of Manasseh, for every matter pertaining to God and affairs of the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the sons of Israel after their number, who were chief fathers and captains of thousands and hundreds, and their officers that served the king in any matter of the courses, who came in and went out month by month throughout all the months of the year, each course was of twenty-four thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Over the first course for the first month was Jashobeam, the son of Zabdiel, and in his course were twenty-four thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the sons of Perez was the chief of all the captains of the host for the first month.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And over the course of the second month was Dodai, an Ahohite, and in his course was prince Mikloth; in his course likewise were twenty-four thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The third captain of the host for the third month was Benaiah, the son of Jehoiada, a chief priest: and in his course were twenty-four thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is that Benaiah, who was mighty among the thirty, and above the thirty; and in his course was Ammizabad, his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fourth for the fourth month was Asahel, the brother of Joab, and Zebadiah his son after him; and in his course were twenty-four thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fifth for the fifth month was prince Shamhuth, the Izrahite; and in his course were twenty-four thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sixth for the sixth month was Ira, the son of Ikkesh of Tekoah; and in his course were twenty-four thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The seventh for the seventh month was Helez, the Pelonite, of the sons of Ephraim; and in his course were twenty-four thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The eighth for the eighth month was Sibbecai, the Hushathite, of Zarhi; and in his course were twenty-four thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The ninth for the ninth month was Abiezer, the Anetothite, of the Benjamites; and in his course were twenty-four thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The tenth for the tenth month was Maharai, the Netophathite of Zarhi; and in his course were twenty-four thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The eleventh for the eleventh month was Benaiah, the Pirathonite, of the sons of Ephraim; and in his course were twenty-four thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The twelfth for the twelfth month was Heldai, the Netophathite of Othniel; and in his course were twenty-four thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Presiding, likewise, over the tribes of Israel: over the Reubenites was prince Eliezer, the son of Zichri; over the Simeonites, Shephatiah, the son of Maachah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Over the Levites, Hashabiah, the son of Kemuel. Over the Aaronites, Zadok.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Over Judah, Elihu, one of the brethren of David. Over those of Issachar, Omri, the son of Michael.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Over those of Zebulun, Ishmaiah, the son of Obadiah. Over those of Naphtali, Jerimoth, the son of Azriel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Over the sons of Ephraim, Hosea, the son of Azaziah. Over the half tribe of Manasseh, Joel, the son of Pedaiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Over the other half tribe of Manasseh in Gilead, Iddo, the son of Zechariah. Over those of Benjamin, Jaasiel, the son of Abner.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And over Dan, Azareel, the son of Jeroham. These were the princes of the tribes of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But David did not number those twenty years old and under because the LORD had said he would multiply Israel like to the stars of the heavens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joab, the son of Zeruiah, had begun to number, but he did not finish; and because of this, wrath fell upon Israel; and thus the number was not put in the account of the chronicles of King David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Azmaveth, the son of Adiel, had charge of the kingâ€™s treasures and of the treasures of the fields, of the cities, and of the villages, and of the castles, was Jehonathan, the son of Uzziah;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and over those that did the work of the tillage of the ground in the fields was Ezri the son of Chelub;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and over the vineyards was Shimei, the Ramathite; over the increase of the vineyards for the wine cellars was Zabdi, the Shiphmite;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and over the olive trees and the sycamore trees that were in the low plains was Baalhanan, the Gederite; and over the cellars of oil, Joash;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and over the cows that fed in Sharon was Shitrai, the Sharonite; and over the cows that were in the valleys was Shaphat, the son of Adlai;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: over the camels, Obil, the Ishmaelite; and over the asses, Jehdeiah, the Meronothite;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and over the sheep was Jaziz, the Hagerite. All these were the princes of the substance which was King Davidâ€™s.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jonathan, Davidâ€™s uncle, was a counsellor, a wise man, and a scribe; and Jehiel the son of Hachmoni had charge of the kingâ€™s sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ahithophel was the kingâ€™s counsellor; and Hushai, the Archite, was the kingâ€™s companion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after Ahithophel was Jehoiada, the son of Benaiah, and Abiathar. And Joab was the general of the kingâ€™s army.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David assembled all the princes of Israel, the princes of the tribes, and the princes of the companies that ministered to the king by course, and the princes over the thousands, and princes over the hundreds, with the princes over all the substance and possession of the king, and his sons, with the officers, and with the mighty men, and with all the valiant men, unto Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David, the king, stood up upon his feet and said, Hear me, my brethren, and my people: As for me, I had in my heart to build a house of rest for the ark of the covenant of the LORD and for the footstool of our God and had made ready for the building.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But God said unto me, Thou shalt not build a house for my name because thou hast been a man of war and hast shed blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, the LORD God of Israel chose me before all the house of my father to be king over Israel for ever, for he has chosen Judah to be the ruler; and of the house of Judah, the house of my father; and among the sons of my father he liked me to make me king over all Israel;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and of all my sons (for the LORD has given me many sons) he has chosen Solomon, my son, to sit upon the throne of the kingdom of the LORD over Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto me, Solomon, thy son, he shall build my house and my courts, for I have chosen him to be my son, and I will be his father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, I will establish his kingdom for ever if he is constant to do my commandments and my judgments as at this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, therefore, in the sight of all Israel the congregation of the LORD and in the audience of our God, keep and seek for all the commandments of the LORD your God, that ye may possess this good land and leave it for an inheritance for your sons after you for ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou, Solomon, my son, know thou the God of thy father and serve him with a perfect heart and with a willing soul, for the LORD searches all hearts and understands all the imaginations of the thoughts. If thou seek him, he will be found of thee; but if thou forsake him, he will cast thee off for ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take heed now, for the LORD has chosen thee to build a house for the sanctuary; be strong, and do it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David gave to Solomon, his son, the pattern of the porch and of its houses and of its treasuries and of its upper chambers and of its inner parlours and of the place of the seat of reconciliation,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the pattern of all that he had received by the Spirit of the courts of the house of the LORD and of all the chambers round about, of the treasuries of the house of God and of the treasuries of the holy things;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: also for the courses of the priests and the Levites, and for all the work of the ministry of the house of the LORD, and for all the vessels of ministry of the house of the LORD.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He gave gold by weight for that of gold, for all the vessels of each manner of service; silver also for all the vessels of silver by weight, for all the vessels of each service.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Gold by weight for the lampstands of gold, and for their lamps of gold, by weight for every lampstand, and for its lamps; and for the lampstands of silver by weight, both for the lampstand and also for its lamps, according to the service of each lampstand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And by weight he gave gold for the tables of showbread, for each table; and, likewise, silver for the tables of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also pure gold for the fleshhooks and the bowls and the cups, and for the golden covers he gave gold by weight for every basin; and likewise silver by weight for every basin of silver;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and for the altar of incense refined gold by weight; and gold for the pattern of the chariot of the cherubim, that spread out their wings and covered the ark of the covenant of the LORD.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All this, said David, the LORD made me understand in writing by his hand upon me, even all the works of this pattern.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David said to Solomon, his son, Be strong and of good courage, and do it; fear not, nor be dismayed, for the LORD God, even my God, will be with thee; he will not leave thee, nor forsake thee, until thou hast finished all the work of the service of the house of the LORD.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold the courses of the priests and the Levites, in all the ministry of the house of God; they shall be with thee in all the work; all of them voluntarily, with wisdom in all ministry; likewise, the princes and all the people to execute all thy commands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Furthermore, David, the king, said unto all the congregation, Only Solomon, my son, has God chosen; he is young and tender, and the work is great, for the palace is not for man, but for the LORD God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now I have prepared with all my might for the house of my God, gold for the things of gold, and silver for the things of silver, and brass for the things of brass, and iron for the things of iron, and wood for the things of wood; onyx stones, and stones to be set, black stones and of different colours, and all manner of precious stones, and marble stones in abundance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, because I have my delight in the house of my God, I have in my own treasury, gold and silver, which I have given to the house of my God, over and above all that I have prepared for the house of the sanctuary:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: three thousand talents of gold, of the gold of Ophir, and seven thousand talents of refined silver, to overlay the walls of the houses;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the gold for things of gold, and the silver for things of silver, and for all manner of work to be made by the hands of the workmen. And who then is willing to consecrate the offering of his hands today unto the LORD?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the princes of the fathers and princes of the tribes of Israel, and the princes of thousands and of hundreds, with the rulers of the kingâ€™s work, offered willingly
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and gave for the service of the house of God five thousand talents of gold and ten thousand daily wages and ten thousand talents of silver and eighteen thousand talents of brass and one hundred thousand talents of iron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And each one gave the precious stones that they had to the treasure of the house of the LORD, into the hand of Jehiel, the Gershonite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the people rejoiced to have offered willingly because with perfect heart they offered willingly to the LORD. Likewise, David the king rejoiced with great joy
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and blessed the LORD before all the congregation; and David said, Blessed be thou, LORD God of Israel our father, for ever and ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thine, O LORD, is the greatness and the power and the glory and the victory and the honour, for all things in the heavens and in the earth are thine; thine is the kingdom, O LORD, and thou art exalted as head above all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The riches and the glory are before thee, and thou dost reign over all, and in thy hand is power and might and in thy hand the greatness and the strength of all things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, therefore, our God, we thank thee, and praise thy glorious name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But who am I, and what is my people, that we should be able to offer so willingly after this sort? For all things come of thee and of thine own have we given thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we are strangers before thee, and sojourners, as were all our fathers; our days on the earth are as a shadow, and there is no other hope.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O LORD our God, all this store that we have prepared to build thee a house for thy holy name comes of thy hand and is all thy own.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I know also, my God, that thou dost try the heart, and hast pleasure in uprightness. As for me, in the uprightness of my heart I have willingly offered all these things; and now have I seen with joy that thy people, who are present here, have given willingly unto thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O LORD God of Abraham, Isaac, and of Israel, our fathers, keep for ever this purpose in the thoughts of the heart of thy people and prepare their heart unto thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Likewise, give unto Solomon, my son, a perfect heart, to keep thy commandments, thy testimonies, and thy statutes, and to do all these things, and to build the palace, for which I have made provision.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David said to all the congregation, Now bless the LORD your God. And all the congregation blessed the LORD God of their fathers and bowed down and worshipped before the LORD and the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they sacrificed sacrifices unto the LORD and offered burnt offerings unto the LORD, on the next day, even a thousand bullocks, a thousand rams, and a thousand lambs, with their drink offerings, and sacrifices in abundance for all Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they ate and drank before the LORD on that day with great gladness. And they made Solomon, the son of David, king the second time and anointed him unto the LORD as ruler and Zadok as priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Solomon sat on the throne of the LORD as king instead of David, his father, and was prospered; and all Israel heard him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the princes and the mighty men and all the sons likewise of King David, submitted themselves unto Solomon, the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the LORD magnified Solomon exceedingly in the sight of all Israel and bestowed upon him such glory of the kingdom as had not been on any king before him in Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus David, the son of Jesse, reigned over all Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the time that he reigned over Israel was forty years; he reigned seven years in Hebron, and he reigned thirty-three years in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he died in a good old age, full of days, riches, and glory; and Solomon his son reigned in his stead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the acts of David, the king, first and last, behold, they are written in the book of Samuel, the seer, and in the book of Nathan, the prophet, and in the book of Gad, the seer,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: with all his reign and his might, and the times that went over him and over Israel and over all the kingdoms of the lands.
verses.speaker: Narrator
